content: Applied to another quant firm today. They're looking for someone with a background in AI. Fingers crossed.
Took a break to visit the Met. Art can be as inspiring as tech. Came back with ideas for visualizing data in ways that might make my trading algorithms more intuitive.
Got a rejection from the first firm I applied to. It stung, but it's a reminder to keep refining my skills. Back to the drawing board, this time with a clearer vision.
Finally got an interview call from the second quant firm. They were intrigued by my AI background. Prepped all night. This could be it.
The interview went well. They asked about my trading algorithm and seemed genuinely interested in its potential. Waiting to hear back.
Met up with my mentor again. He's impressed with my progress and suggested I look into blockchain for potential integration with AI. New avenue to explore.
Just finished a two-day intensive course on blockchain fundamentals. My head is spinning with ideas on how to combine it with my trading strategies.
Received an offer from the quant firm! It's not exactly what I envisioned, but it's a start. Negotiating terms now. The journey continues, with more lessons learned and new horizons to explore.
